ARABIC: وَلَوْلَا كَلِمَةٌ سَبَقَتْ مِن رَّبِّكَ لَكَانَ لِزَامًا وَأَجَلٌ مُّسَمًّى

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And were it not for a prior word from your Lord, and a specified term, it would inevitably have already taken place.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: If the decree (of respite) had not been pronounced by your Lord, (the inevitable judgement would have ensued); but a term is fixed (for everything).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Were it not for a word already gone from your Lord, the decree (of their destruction) would have come to pass.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Had not the word of your Lord been decreed (otherwise), the unbelievers deserved immediate punishment. The appointed time for their punishment will inevitably come.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And had not a command of your Lord been passed, then the punishment would have gripped them – and had a term not been appointed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And had it not been for a Word that went forth before from your Lord, and a term determined, (their punishment) must necessarily have come (in this world).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And had there not been a word (that had) already gone forth from your Lord and an appointed term, it would surely have been made to cleave (to them).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And but for a word that preceded from thy Lord, and a stated term, it had been fastened.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And but for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Lord, and a term already fixed, the judgment would have been inevitable (in this world).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But for a pre-ordained Word from your Lord, and a term [of respite] already fixed, immediate punishment would inevitably have taken place.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And had not a word from thy Lord gone forth, and a term determined, it must necessarily have come.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Were it not for a prior decree of your Lord and a specified time, [their doom] would have attended [their guilt].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Had it not been for a Word that went forth before from thy Lord, (their punishment) must necessarily have come; but there is a Term appointed (for respite).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And had it not been for a Word that went forth before from your Lord, and a term determined, (their punishment) must necessarily have come (in this world).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Except for a Word that preceded from your Lord, and a stated term, it had been fastened.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Were it not for a word that issued from your Lord, the inevitable would have happened, but there is an appointed term.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, punishment would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:129] And but for a decree that had already preceded from your Lord, that their chastisement be deferred to the Hereafter, it, destruction, would have been an inevitability, [their destruction] would have been necessary in this world, and a specified term, fixed for them (ajalun musamman, a supplement to the pronoun concealed in kāna, ‘it would have been’, the separation [of both subjects] by the predicate of both serves as an   emphasis).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And but for a decree that had already gone forth from thy Lord) that their punishment shall be postponed, (and a term already fixed) for this nation, (the judgement would (have) been inevitable (in this world)) their punishment would have been inevitable.
